rev.comment: a little more NPOV and a wikilink.
restore cleanup tags that disappeared a few weeks ago without discussion
/* Eschatology */ important differentiating point between RCC and EO is prayer for pagans
Hypertexting several links. Capitalizing "Trinity" as a proper noun.
/* Relations with other Christians */ fact tag, more Protestants than EO
/* Number of adherents */ more Protestants than Eastern Orthodox
/* Relations with other Christians */Though I have made some corrections, I still wonder is this section worth keeping at all
/* The Church today */ new section to help reader see EO in overall Christian context
Undo: what is the point of the addition? In context, three well known examples is plenty... more disrupts the sentence flow.
put some fact and not your rasict bullshit
/* Church today */ small change to header
/* The Theotokos and the Saints */ lowercase

these aree the numbers that includes non church goers

/* Orthodox churches in communion */ the coount is 14(15), not 13(14). Please correct in the text, or in this list.
/* Orthodox churches in communion */Whence "13 (14 by some)"?
The article is called the Eastern Orthodox Church
remove new content - unsourced, severe oversimplification.
/* Nomenclature */ In most english sources I've seen the name "Orthodox Catholic" refers to the Eastern Orthodox Church, english readers should be informed about this.
/* Nomenclature */ I don't think there's any need to mention this in the "Nomenlcature" section. (The "History" section explains this instead.)
/* Nomenclature */ Removed this bit. There is a fake Orthodox Group calling themselves the Orthodox Catholic Church. The reference given was hardly scholarly.
/* Bible, holy tradition, and the patristic consensus */ lk
For the Roman Catholic Church to be listed as a Christian organization established in the 1st century but for the Eastern Orthodox Church to not be allowed to be such is simply absurd.

Date maintenance tags and general fixes
/* Marriage */ Restored definition. See Discussion page
agree with Phiddipus. This doesn't belong in lead, but can be mentioned later on. Also, please use a more reliable source
Since [[Orthodox Catholic Church]] is now a redirect, the name is mentioned again.
The Orthodox Church has many names, the most common being Eastern or Greek or Russian all of which were once mentioned, Orthodox Catholic is a vague and barely used term
I believe there are enough sources to justify the mention of this name. Please check the talk page.
/* Marriage */ In light of recent events in California and other states this addition seems very reactionary and inappropriate. The Church only recognizes Orthodox marriages as valid anyway
Restore "Church today" section to state pre-weirdness
/* Number of adherents */ In RoM the the number is 64-65%, please check the wiki page on Republic of Macedonia. The current number is inconsistent and unsourced
reinstating tags. General like of citations throughout. Uncited material subject to [[WP:OR]] guidelines. Please add sources.
These assertions need to be sourced and in any case do not belong in the lead.
I have never in my lifetime heard it called that. I have never seen it written that way in any literature. Besides we took all the "Also known as" out
/* Number of adherents */ remove stray period
Enhancing the lead to mention church size/number of adherents

/* Bible, holy tradition, and the patristic consensus */ We like to avoid comparisons. Using the term "Sister church" implies all sorts of incorrect beliefs held by Orthodox
slight re-wording. Adding of links to Scripture
I blended two distinct versions of the sin and salvation sections, with the hopes that the community could collectively decide on the content rather than simply individuals.

Undo: unsourced, unlikely. Ethiopian churh isn't Eastern Orthodox; it's non-Chalcedonian.
/* Nomenclature */ The term "Copt" was being used, which unhelpfully only refers to one particular church of the Non-Chalcedonian movement. Changed to Oriental Orthodox.
/* Orthodox Churches and communities not in communion with others */ - removing some redlinks
/* Ecumenical councils */ I moved the Fourth Council of Constantinople back to the listing of authoritatively recognized Ecumenical Councils due to the Encyclical of the Eastern Patriarchs.
/* Age of captivity */ Yes. The church acquired authority over civil matters, which it previously did not have. See linked article for "millet".
/* Age of captivity */ Acquired? Are you saying that a Sunni Muslim state gave them more power than an Christian Orthodox state? It was the state religion before.

clean up, typos fixed: occured â occurred using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
/* Great Schism */ None of this is appropriate. It is all Roman Catholic POV
/* Orthodox churches in communion */ Ro recognizes Mo Church; the conflict is about the succession of the Metropolis banned in the '40s by the Soviets
/* Number of adherents */ rem Armenians, per talk page
/* The Cross */ well meaning addition but incorrect. Orthodox crosses are not usually inscribd in Latin. Greek and Slavonic are the most common
/* Orthodox Churches and communities not in communion with others */
/* Orthodox churches in communion */ reorganize this listing, giving it some sense
/* Icons */ This has been discussed many times before - Icon "Writing" is an affectation - The use of paint makes it a painting in English. Example: Photographs aren't written
/* A Note on Nomenclature */ Clarification - it sounded as if the OC, the RC, and others all continued to belong to the One Holy Catholic and Apostolic Church
Put list in order of size and include third biggest claimant
